text: There is no real difference except budget, so you will work on more exciting stuff in film. But saying that alot of TV series (witcher, game of thrones, mandalorian etc.) are big budget. So the difference is getting smaller each year

Ahhh, okay. I have seen the amount of big budget TV series increasing as well as streaming services, does that mean that there will be an increase in job opportunities when it comes to working within the VFX television industry?

It is a possibility, but from what I see most big budget TV series are done by large production houses like Weta, Framestore, Cinesite, MPC, DNEG and ILM. But saying that the industry itself is always expanding so new jobs are being created every year

That’s exciting to hear that new job opportunities are being created, and I do see a lot of stuff being posted by those bigger houses surrounding the shows they’ve worked on. Do you see a lot of opportunities for graduates within the industry?
